channel.description:
Looking at other update logs, I think my JagSocket.getOutputStream() hook may be incorrect. If you could confirm/deny would be appreciated. Also, if there is a better way to hook methods, I would appreciate it.
Zephyrion Updater ------------------------- ^ wa implements hooks.SoftwareToolkit * getNativeID() --> field J wa.nativeid ^ uj implements hooks.Node # unlink() --> method uj.a(Z)V ^ sd implements hooks.NodeCache * getCache() --> field [Luj; sd.l ^ wda implements hooks.JagSocket * getSocket() --> field Ljava/net/Socket; wda.g * getBuffer() --> field [B wda.p * getOutputStream() --> field Ljava/io/OutputStream; wda.t * getInputStream() --> field Ljava/io/InputStream; wda.u ^ wr implements hooks.FileOnDisk * getRandomAccessFile() --> field Ljava/io/RandomAccessFile; wr.d * getFile() --> field Ljava/io/File; wr.f ^ mu implements hooks.SeekableFile # write() --> method mu.a(I[BII)V # read() --> method mu.a(III[B)V # seek() --> method mu.a(IJ)V ^ tq implements hooks.SignLink * getEventQueue() --> field Ljava/awt/EventQueue; tq.A ^ cj implements hooks.ClientScript ^ client implements hooks.Client

item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

chri5:

Aren’t these just the transforms for a framework that’s released on another forum…?

Yes, but i didn’t use the transforms from there. I’m not a skid.

item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

frank_:

seems like both

Most of the things I’ve hooked, i understand how i hooked them, and what the hooks actually represent. I’m used to the RT3 or RT4 Engine(whichever the 317/377 was) So i’m not entirely sure what things like SoftwareToolkit, ClientScript, etc do.

Read full topic

item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Cowie`:

you dont have any idea what half of your ‘hooks’ actually do, you just see people hook them so you do.

item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

If you have a use for hooking a method (like in a bot), then how you ‘hook’ it depends on how you want to use it. You could do it like some bots (I have ZetaBot in mind) and inject event dispatchers into some methods (game loop, animation updates, messages, whatever).
Alternatively you could do a detour-esque hook by invoking your own method with the original arguments and then acting accordingly (for example, when rendering, your detour method could check to see which type of object is being rendered, and if it fits some criteria, apply a flat color shader and invoke the original, or just don’t invoke the original at all, whatever).

How are you ‘hooking’ them currently?

Read full topic

item.description:

Looking at other update logs, I think my JagSocket.getOutputStream() hook may be incorrect. If you could confirm/deny would be appreciated. Also, if there is a better way to hook methods, I would appreciate it.

^ uj implements hooks.Node

unlink() --> method uj.a(Z)V

  • getInputStream() --> field Ljava/io/InputStream; wda.u

^ wr implements hooks.FileOnDisk

  • getRandomAccessFile() --> field Ljava/io/RandomAccessFile; wr.d
  • getFile() --> field Ljava/io/File; wr.f
